00056 typedef struct {
00057         int i; // general index
00058         int m; // molecule index
00059         int r; // residue index
00060         int a; // atom index
00061 } molindex;
00062 typedef struct {
00063         int i; // general index
00064         int E; // ensemble
00065         int A; // assembly
00066         int m; // molecule index
00067         int r; // residue index
00068         int a; // atom index
00069 } ensindex;
00070 
00071 typedef struct { // for simple, all-one-residue bonding (for early programs)
00072         int s; // "source" -- index to first atom in bond
00073                 // this is redundant within an atom structure, but
00074                 // not if the bond structure is used independently
00075         int t; // "target" -- index to the other atom in the bond
00076         double o; // order of bond
00077         bond_type *typ; // pointer to type of bond
00078         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ
00079         char *D; // free-form description
00080 } bond; // an actual bond (as opposed to an expected one)
00081 typedef struct {
00082         int n; // number of bonds
00083         bond *b; // n of these
00084 } bondset; // set of consecutive bonds
00085 typedef struct {
00086 // See the documentation directory for more information
00087         int ni; // number incoming bonds
00088         molindex *i; // atoms making incoming bonds
00089         int no; // number outgoing bonds
00090         molindex *o; // atoms making outgoing bonds
00091         molindex oref; // index of grandparent incoming atom to use to set torsion
00092         char RS, DL; // for R/S and D/L type chirality
00093         int pm; // for optical activity
00094         char *iso; // other description of isomerism
00095         double *angle; // angles (no + ni - 1)
00096         double *chirot; // chirality rotation (no + ni - 2)
00097         molindex itors; // index of grandparent incoming atom to use to set torsion
00098         double tors; // the torsion angle 
00099         double *distance; // distances (no)
00100 } connection_tree; // for detailed descriptions of 
00101 
00102 typedef struct {
00103         molindex s,t; // source & target atoms for bond
00104         double o; // order 
00105         bond_type *typ; // pointer to type of bond
00106         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ
00107         char *D; // free-form description
00108 } molbond; // set of consecutive bonds
00109 
00110 typedef struct {
00111         int n;  // number of these
00112         molbond *b; // n of them
00113         char *D; // free-form description
00114 } molbondset; // set of consecutive bonds
00115 
00116 typedef struct {
00117         molindex a,b,c; // three atoms in the angle
00118         double ang; // the angle
00119         angle_type *typ; // pointer to type of angle
00120         char *D;// free-form descriptor
00121         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ
00122 } angle_index; // index to atoms in an angle
00123 typedef struct {
00124         molindex a,b,c,d; // four atoms defining the torsion
00125         double ang; // the angle
00126         torsion_type *typ; // pointer to type of torsion
00127         char *D;// free-form descriptor
00128         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ
00129 } torsion_index; // index to atoms in an angle

00131 /********** structure atom *************/
00132 typedef struct {
00133         int n; // atom number or other identifying index
00134         char *N; // atom name 
00135         char *T; // atom type name
00136         char *D; // free-form description
00137         int t; // type number -- must correspond to assignments of "atype" (see)
00138         atype *typ; // pointer to atype structure
00139         molindex moli; // the molecule index for this atom (address)
00140         int nb; // number of actual bonds (not expected bonds)
00141         bond *b; // bond structures (nb of these)
00142         int nmb; // number of bonds to other residues or molecules
00143         molbond *mb; // nmb of these
00144         coord_3D x; // atom's coordinates 
00145         int nalt; // number of alternate coordinate sets
00146         coord_3D *xa; // nalt of alternate coords
00147         int nvec; // number of vector sets
00148         vectormag_3D *v; // vector sets
00149         int nch; // number of charges
00150         double *ch; // nch charges for this atom
00151         int ni; // number of other indices
00152         int *i; // other indices, as needed (ni of these)
00153         int nd; // number of double-precision parameters
00154         double *d; // other parameters, as needed (nd of these) 
00155         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00156         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00157         char *sres; // name of some other/original residue to which this atom belonged
00158         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00159         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00160         int nVP; // number of void structures
00161         void *VP; // nVP of these, whatever they may be
00162 } atom; // an actual atom in a residue/molecule
00163 
00164 /********** structure residue *************/
00165 typedef struct {
00166         int n; // residue number given in input file
00167         char *N; // residue name 
00168         char *D; // free-form description for residue
00169         int t; // type number
00170         rtype *typ; // pointer to atype structure
00171         molindex moli; // the molecule index for this residue (address -- set .a to -1 or 0) 
00172         int na; // number of atoms in residue
00173         double m; // molecular weight
00174         coord_3D COM; // center of mass for residue
00175         atom *a; // atom structures (na of these)
00176         connection_tree *T; // na of these
00177         int nbs; // number of bond sets 
00178         bondset *bs; // (consecutive bonds, use these for plotting, etc.)
00179         int nr; // number of simple rings (no cage structures, etc.)
00180         int nrbs; // number of ring bondsets defined
00181         bondset *rbs; // bondsets for rings
00182         int nrc; // number of ring/reference coordinate sets defined
00183         coord_3D *rc; // coordinates for ring/reference centers
00184         int nrp; // number of ring planes defined
00185         plane *rp; // equations for average/approximate/exact/etc. ring planes (where useful)
00186         // need something for more complex structures eventually
00187         int ni; // number of other indices
00188         int *i; // other indices, as needed (ni of these)
00189         int nd; // number of double-precision parameters
00190         double *d; // other parameters, as needed (nd of these)
00191         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00192         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00193         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00194         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00195         int nVP; // number of void structures
00196         void *VP; // nVP of these, whatever they may be
00197 } residue; // an actual residue in a molecule
00198 
00199 /********** structure molecule *************/
00200 typedef struct {
00201         int i; // index
00202         char *N; // free-form name for molecule
00203         char *D; // free-form description for residue
00204         double m; // molecular weight
00205         int Ei; // number corresponding to parent ensemble
00206         int t; // type number
00207         mtype *typ; // pointer to atype structure
00208         coord_3D COM; // center of mass for molecule
00209         int na; // total number of atoms in molecule
00210         atom **a; // na of these, but should point into residues
00211         connection_tree *aT; // nat of these
00212         int nr; // number of residues
00213         residue *r; // pointers to residues
00214         connection_tree *rT; // nr of these
00215         int nrb; // number of bonds between residues
00216         molbond *rb; // nrb of these descriptions of bonds 
00217         int nrbs; // number of sets of bonds between residues (for example, linear chains)
00218         molbondset *rbs; // nrbs of these sets
00219         int nrc; // number of additional reference coordinates (rings, for example)
00220         coord_3D *rc; // nrc of these
00221         coord_3D boxl,boxh; // box dimensions
00222         int noi; // number of other indices
00223         int *oi; // other indices, as needed (ni of these)
00224         int nd; // number of double-precision parameters
00225         double *d; // other parameters, as needed (nd of these)
00226         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00227         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00228         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00229         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00230         int nVP; // number of void structures
00231         void *VP; // nVP of these, whatever they may be
00232 } molecule;
00233 
00234 /********** structure dockinfo *************/
00235 typedef struct{
00236         int i; // index
00237         int n; // number of docked structures represented
00238         coord_3D RC, *TR; // reference coordinate ; translation for docked structure
00239         vectormag_3D *Q, *QN, *QN0; // Quaternion x,y,z,w ; Quaternion nx,ny,nz,angle
00240         // NOTE!! do -not- use typical vectormag_3D functions on these structures
00241         int nTors; // Number of Torsions 
00242         double *Tors; // nTors torsions
00243         double *eFEB; // Estimated Free Energy of Binding, kcal/mol [=(1)+(3)]
00244         double *eKi, *Tmp; // Estimated Inhibition Constant, Ki & temperature, Kelvin
00245         double *fDE; // Final Docked Energy, kcal/mol [=(1)+(2)]
00246         double *fIE; // (1) Final Intermolecular Energy   
00247         double *fIEL; // (2) Final Internal Energy of Ligand 
00248         double *TFE; // (3) Torsional Free Energy          
00249         int nDIH; // number of dihedrals
00250         double *DIH; // the dihedrals
00251         molecule M; // to hold molecule info about the initial/docked structures
00252 } dockinfo;

00254 /********** structure assembly *************/
00255 typedef struct { // structure for groups of molecules within a larger structure
00256         int i; // index
00257         char *N; // name
00258         char *D; // description (free-form) (was *desc)
00259         double mass; // mass of assembly
00260         coord_3D COM; // center of mass 
00261         int nm; // number of molecule structures
00262         molecule **m; // nm of these
00263         connection_tree *mT; // nm of these
00264         //int nmb; // number of bonds/connections between molecules (H-bonds, for example)
00265         //molbond *mb; // nmb of these descriptions of connection 
00266         int nr; // number of residues
00267         residue **r; // nr of these -- probably best to point into molecules...
00268         connection_tree *rT; // nr of these
00269         int na; // number of atoms
00270         atom **a; // na of these -- probably best to point into mol/res combos
00271         connection_tree *aT; // nat of these
00272         int nb; // total number of bonds
00273         molbond *b; // the bonds
00274         int nANG; // # of angles
00275         angle_index *ANG; // nANG of these
00276         int nTOR; // # of torsions
00277         torsion_index *TOR; // nTOR of these
00278         int nPRM; // number of parameter sets
00279         parameter_set *PRM; // pointer to parameter sets
00280         int nmbs; // number of sets of connections between molecules 
00281         molbondset *mbs; // nmbs of these sets
00282         coord_3D boxl,boxh; // box dimensions (limits low & high or just use one for size)
00283         double boxang; // coord_3D is x, y and z -- angle (probably between XY and YZ planes in degrees, maybe).  
00284         char *boxtype; // type of box
00285         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00286         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00287         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00288         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00289         int nVP; // number of void pointers
00290         void *VP; // void pointers
00291 } assembly;
00292 
00293 /********** structure ensemble *************/
00294 typedef struct { // structure for an entire system of molecules
00295         int i; // index
00296         char *N; // name
00297         char *D; // free-form descriptor
00298         double mass; // mass of ensemble
00299         coord_3D COM; // center of mass 
00300         int nm; // number of molecule structures
00301         molecule *m; // nm of these
00302         int na; // number of assembly structures
00303         assembly *a; // na of these
00304         coord_3D boxl,boxh; // box dimensions
00305         int nPRM; // number of parameter sets
00306         parameter_set *PRM; // pointer to parameter sets
00307         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00308         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00309         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00310         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00311         int nVP; // number of void pointers
00312         void *VP; // void pointers
00313 } ensemble;

00315 /* The following is a set of functions intended primarily to facilitate 
00316 debugging.  But, they could easily be used for verbose data output within
00317 the program.  They all follow the same basic format:
00318 
00319 print_X(X *x, int level)
00320 
00321 where   X = one of the structures defined above (e.g., molecule, residue, 
00322                 bondset, atom, bond, atype, plane, vectormag_3D, coord_3D).
00323         *x = pointer to your structure
00324         level = the depth to print.  This is only available on structures 
00325                 likely to contain arrays of other structures.  level=0 only
00326                 prints the top-level information.  level=1 prints one level 
00327                 down of other structures, lists, etc. level=2 prints two 
00328                 levels down, etc.   The value of level can be larger than 
00329                 the depth available -- the function will stop when it runs
00330                 out of structures to print.  
00331 */
00332 int NUMAT;

00334 void print_bondset(bondset*,int),print_atom(atom*,int),print_bond(bond*);
00335 void print_atype(atype*,int),print_plane(plane*);
00336 void print_vectormag_3D(vectormag_3D*),print_coord_3D(coord_3D*);

00348 /* the following are geometric operations for the structures defined above 
00349         where int is xl ("x" (coordinate) location):
00350                 xl refers to position in the atom structure
00351                         xl=-1 means use the atom.x structure
00352                         xl=0,1,2,etc means use the atom.xa[xl] or
00353                                 the atom.v[xl] structure
00354         where int,int is "xl,vl" it refers to coord and vector location
00355                 (in that order).
00356         where int is n
00357                 n indicates the number of blocks in the preceding pointer
00358 
00359    All of the following that involve vectors will set the magnitude of 
00360         the resulting vector without relying on the entry in the input 
00361         vector.  So, for example, there is no need to get_magnitude 
00362         before normalizing or multiplying by a scalar.
00363 */
00364 /* this moves all the coords in molecule so that the center of mass
00365 for the molecule is at the origin (right now, though, it only works
00366 if the molecule has only one residue...*/
00367 void translate_to_COM(molecule *,atype *,int); // int is xl
00368         // this assumes the initial coords are in atom.x
00369 //void translate_zero_to_COM(molecule *,atype *,int,int); 
00370         // int#1 is xs, the location of the source coords
00371         // int#2 is xt, the location of the translated coords
00372 void translate_zero_to_coord_M(molecule *,int,int,coord_3D); 
00373         // int#1 is xs, the location of the source coords
00374         // int#2 is xt, the location of the translated coords
00375 void assign_residue_COM(residue *r,atype *ATYPE);
00376 void assign_molecule_COM(molecule *m,atype *ATYPE);
00377 void assign_assembly_COM(assembly *a,atype *ATYPE);
00378 void assign_ensemble_COM(ensemble *e,atype *ATYPE);
00379 coord_3D get_residue_COM(residue *r,atype *ATYPE,int xs);
00380 coord_3D get_molecule_COM(molecule *m,atype *ATYPE,int xs);
00381 coord_3D get_assembly_COM(assembly *a,atype *ATYPE,int xs);
00382 coord_3D get_ensemble_COM(ensemble *e,atype *ATYPE,int xs);

00384 /* the following functions rotate the coordinate list such that the
00385 vector given by vectormag_3D points along the Z (Y, X, other) axis.
00386 The orientation of the orthogonal axes is arbitrary. */
00387 void rotate_vector_to_Z_M(molecule*,int,int,int,int,vectormag_3D); 
00388         // The four integers are:
00389         // int#1 location of source coordinates (-1=x, 0,1,2,etc=xa[xs]
00390         // int#2 location of rotated coordinates (-1=x, 0,1,2,etc=xa[xs]
00391         // int#3 location of source vectors (-1=do not calc, 0,1,2,etc=v[xs]
00392         // int#4 location of rotated vectors (-1=do not calc, 0,1,2,etc=v[xs]
00393 void rotate_vector_to_Z_list(coord_3D*,int,vectormag_3D); // int is n
